title: The Privilege Defense
premise: A rising star defense attorney, celebrated for getting powerful men acquitted, discovers her latest client—a tech billionaire accused of murder—isn't just guilty. He's the mastermind behind a secret society that targets the women who testify against their members, and she's next on their list. To survive, she must use every legal loophole she knows to build a case against him from the inside, while her own privileged communications become the trap that could get her killed.
protagonist: Elena Vance, a brilliant but ethically flexible defense attorney who begins to question the system she's mastered.
conflict: Elena must outmaneuver her own client using the very attorney-client privilege that binds her, turning the tools of her trade into weapons before she becomes the next victim of the syndicate she's unwittingly protected.
setting: Present-day Seattle, moving from sleek high-rise courtrooms and corporate offices to the city's hidden, gritty underbelly.
tone: Claustrophobic, paranoia-fueled, and intellectually sharp, blending the high-stakes tension of a courtroom drama with the relentless peril of a conspiracy thriller.
